p: If the need for a software framework to assess surveillance systems has previously been recognized [ 29], we could find no published precedent for a modular test bed where both case- and outbreak-detection methods can be interchanged. Because adjustments in statistical alarm thresholds are method-specific and their effect on FAR unpredictable, we used simulations to determine the relationship between FAR and detection delay empirically. A graphical representation of this relationship intuitively informed a performance trade-off of key concern to public health practitioners.
